content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # regex to find julia language code block
    r = Regex("```julia", "gm")

    # match each code block and remove the fences
    blocks = Array{SubString}(undef)
    while true
        m = search(r, md)
        if m === nothing
            break
        end
        startpos = position(md, r, m.first - 1)
        # find end of code block fence
        endpos = position(md, r, m.first + 1)
        if startpos == endpos
            continue
        end
        content = SubString(md, startpos + 8, endpos - 8)  # trim whitespace around fences
        blocks = append!(blocks, strip(content))
    end

    return join(blocks, "\n")
end
```

Please note that the function `strip` is used to remove leading and trailing whitespace from the matched code block content.
